title: Renault Triber facelift spotted with redesigned fascia
description: The Renault Triber facelift has been spied testing with substantial styling changes on the front end. Renault India MD and CEO Venkatram Mamillapalle confirmed earlier this year that the Kiger and Triber would receive facelifts later in 2025, and a newly-spotted test mule of the updated sub-4-metre MPV suggests that it may sport a bevy of design tweaks. Renault Triber facelift gets new LED headlights, restyled front bumper Interior design likely to be retained from current Triber with new materials and features Facelifted Triber's engine options are expected to remain unchanged  2025 Renault Triber facelift exterior and interior design New LED headlights and revised front bumper Recent spy shots of a heavily camouflaged Triber test mule reveal that up front, the facelifted compact MPV will get reshaped headlights containing a sleek LED strip on the upper edge. This headlight design interestingly mirrors that of Nissan’s upcoming Triber-based MPV, which was teased a few months ago and is confirmed to launch early next year in India. Image credit: vshankar88 via YouTube The similarities to the Nissan MPV end there for now, though, as the Triber facelift’s front bumper has a much larger air dam, repositioned fog lamp units, and potentially a different grille design. Moving to the side, we expect new alloy wheels for the Triber facelift as well, but the rear end likely won’t be all that different from the current model, save for perhaps new LED signatures in the tail-lamps and an updated bumper. Interior changes for Triber facelift Current Renault Triber dashboard used for representation. Inside, the Triber facelift’s dashboard is expected to receive mild design tweaks, lighter shades, more soft-touch materials and an expanded features list, much like the refreshed Nissan Magnite that went on sale last year. 2025 Renault Triber facelift engine and gearbox No major mechanical changes anticipated On the powertrain front, we expect the Triber facelift to carry on with the current model’s 1.0-litre naturally aspirated three-cylinder petrol unit that generates 72hp and 96Nm. Gearbox options will most likely be the same as well, comprising a 5-speed manual and 5-speed AMT. html:
The Renault Triber will receive its first facelift in 2025, six years after the compact MPV initially launched.

The Renault Triber facelift has been spied testing with substantial styling changes on the front end. Renault India MD and CEO Venkatram Mamillapalle confirmed earlier this year that the Kiger and Triber would receive facelifts later in 2025, and a newly-spotted test mule of the updated sub-4-metre MPV suggests that it may sport a bevy of design tweaks.

  1. Renault Triber facelift gets new LED headlights, restyled front bumper
  2. Interior design likely to be retained from current Triber with new materials and features
  3. Facelifted Triber's engine options are expected to remain unchanged 

2025 Renault Triber facelift exterior and interior design

New LED headlights and revised front bumper

Recent spy shots of a heavily camouflaged Triber test mule reveal that up front, the facelifted compact MPV will get reshaped headlights containing a sleek LED strip on the upper edge. This headlight design interestingly mirrors that of Nissan’s upcoming Triber-based MPV, which was teased a few months ago and is confirmed to launch early next year in India.

Image credit: vshankar88 via YouTube

The similarities to the Nissan MPV end there for now, though, as the Triber facelift’s front bumper has a much larger air dam, repositioned fog lamp units, and potentially a different grille design. Moving to the side, we expect new alloy wheels for the Triber facelift as well, but the rear end likely won’t be all that different from the current model, save for perhaps new LED signatures in the tail-lamps and an updated bumper.

Interior changes for Triber facelift

Current Renault Triber dashboard used for representation.

Inside, the Triber facelift’s dashboard is expected to receive mild design tweaks, lighter shades, more soft-touch materials and an expanded features list, much like the refreshed Nissan Magnite that went on sale last year.

2025 Renault Triber facelift engine and gearbox

No major mechanical changes anticipated

On the powertrain front, we expect the Triber facelift to carry on with the current model’s 1.0-litre naturally aspirated three-cylinder petrol unit that generates 72hp and 96Nm. Gearbox options will most likely be the same as well, comprising a 5-speed manual and 5-speed AMT.
